title: Improved genomic DNA extraction from citrus species using a modified CTAB method.
abstract: Citrus species are recalcitrant to DNA extraction due to high levels of polysaccharides, polyphenols, and secondary metabolites that interfere with DNA yield and purity. This study presents an optimized cetyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB)-based protocol for efficient genomic DNA isolation from citrus leaves.
